dt: {bc}a person who looks on (as at a sports event)

pt: The Latin word {it}specere{/it}, meaning {ldquo}to look{rdquo} or {ldquo}to look at,{rdquo} gives us the roots {b}spec{/b}, {b}spic{/b}, and {b}spect{/b}. Words from the Latin {it}specere{/it} have something to do with looking or watching. A {b}spect{/b}{it}ator{/it} is a person who watches something, such as a sports event. Anything {it}con{/it}{b}spic{/b}{it}uous{/it} is easy to see. To {it}in{/it}{b}spect{/b} is to look very closely at all parts of something. A {b}spec{/b}{it}imen{/it}, or sample, is one example or one part that can show what the rest look like.

shortdef: a person who looks on (as at a sports event)
a person who looks on (as at a sports event)
